habitat_description: The distribution of this species is restricted to several river drainages of Texas. Populations are found along the Brazos, Guadalupe, Colorado, and San Antonio river drainages (Etchberger and Iverson 1990). In this area, the Texas cooter can be observed in creeks and medium sized rivers, but also in shallow pools of water (Natureserve.org). It is commonly found in tributaries and nearby ponds. The habitats if preference are usually characterized by abundant vegetation and basking locations (Garrett and Barker 1987). Conant (1975) reported sightings in ditches and tanks used for cattle. This species is regarded as a benthic species that burrows in or using soil, decaying logs, and leaf litter. The nests are burrowed near water (Garrett and Barker 1987).
